DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sequence of letters, numbers, or other characters formatted according to the HTAN Identifiers SOP that uniquely identifies a biospecimen obtained for research purposes.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A collaborative network, funded by the National Cancer Institute's Cancer Moonshot initiative, that was established to develop a clinical, experimental, computational, and organizational framework for the construction of three-dimensional atlases of cancer transitions for a diverse set of human tumor types._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: A collaborative network, funded by the National Cancer Institute's Cancer Moonshot initiative, that was established to develop a clinical, experimental, computational, and organizational framework for the construction of three-dimensional atlases of cancer transitions for a diverse set of human tumor types.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: A collaborative network, funded by the National Cancer Institute's Cancer Moonshot initiative, that was established to develop a clinical, experimental, computational, and organizational framework for the construction of three-dimensional atlases of cancer transitions for a diverse set of human tumor types.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/31/22 jk released for HTAN use. 3/29/22 jk upd semantics for consistency with other HTAN biospecimen identifier CDEs.  2/2/22 jk created for SRRS Biospecimen upload data set.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A sequence of letters, numbers, and other characters formatted as HTA15_AXXXX_YYYYY where HTA15 is the HTAN SRRS site identifier, A is 1-2 digits capturing the HTAN site id, XXXX the site patient identifier, and YYYYY is a site assigned biospecimen identifier

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A collaborative network, funded by the National Cancer Institute's Cancer Moonshot initiative, that was established to develop a clinical, experimental, computational, and organizational framework for the construction of three-dimensional atlases of cancer transitions for a diverse set of human tumor types. :One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A collaborative network, funded by the National Cancer Institute's Cancer Moonshot initiative, that was established to develop a clinical, experimental, computational, and organizational framework for the construction of three-dimensional atlases of cancer transitions for a diverse set of human tumor types.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/29/22 jk add ref doc/text in def to describe SRRS identifier format.  2/25/22 jk apprvd by SME, released for SRRS imaging data set.  2/2/22 jk Created for HTAN Identifier data values.

ReferenceDocuments.name: HTAN Term
ReferenceDocuments.description: Formatted as HTA15_AXXXX_YYYYY where HTA15 is the HTAN SRRS site identifier, A is 1-2 digits capturing the HTAN site id, XXXX the site patient identifier, and YYYYY is a site assigned biospecimen identifier.

DataElement.changeDescription: 3/31/22 jk released for HTAN use.  3/29/22 jk updated for revised DEC for consistency with other HTAN biospecimen id data values.  2/24/22 jk add ref doc to define format of identifier.  2/2/22 jk created for SRRS Biospecimen upload data set.
